textAfterTable: 14 Songs Biography Formed: 1921 in Nashville, TN Genre: Christian & Gospel Years Active: '20s, '30s, '40s, '50s, '60s, '70s, '80s, '90s During the 1940s, the Fairfield Four were among the top-ranked gospel quartets, along with the Dixie Hummingbirds, Five Blind Boys, and Soul Stirrers. Originally a gospel duet created in the early '20s by the pastor of Fairfield Baptist Church in Nashville to occupy his sons, Harry and Rufus Carrethers, they became a gospel trio with the addition of John Battle. The group was transformed into a jubilee quartet by the '30s and began the first of numerous personnel changes. They recorded for RCA Victor... Full bio Top Albums and Songs by The Fairfield Four
